message.text: Actions job or workflow does not limit the permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN. Consider setting an explicit permissions block, using the following as a minimal starting point: {{contents: read}}

steps.name: Extract info
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail

branch_name="release-${{ inputs.version }}"
echo "branch_name=${branch_name}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

steps.name: Make release branch
steps.run: git switch -c "${{ env.branch_name }}"

steps.name: Do release
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail
git config user.name github-actions
git config user.email github-actions@github.com
cargo release \
  --execute \
  --no-push \
  --no-tag \
  --no-publish \
  --no-confirm \
  --verbose \
  --config release.toml \
  --allow-branch "${{ env.branch_name }}" \
  --dependent-version upgrade \
  "${{ inputs.version }}"

steps.name: Push new branch
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail
git push origin "${{ env.branch_name }}"

steps.name: Create PR
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail

nl=$'\n'
br=$'\n\n'
fence=$'```\n'
ecnef=$'\n```'

title="release: v${{ inputs.version }}"
body_intro="This is a release PR for version **${{ inputs.version }}**."
body_merge="**Use squash merge.** Upon merging, this will automatically build the CLI and create a GitHub release. You still need to manually publish the cargo crate."
body_pub="${fence}$ cd ${{ env.crate_path }}${nl}$ cargo publish${ecnef}"
body_notes="---${br}_Edit release notes into the section below:_${br}<!-- do not change or remove this heading -->${nl}### Release notes"

body="${body_intro}${br}${body_merge}${br}${body_pub}${br}${body_notes}${br}"

gh pr create --title "$title" --body "$body" --base main --head "${{ env.branch_name }}" --label "release"

steps.name: Extract info
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail

branch_name="release-${{ inputs.version }}"
echo "branch_name=${branch_name}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

steps.name: Make release branch
steps.run: git switch -c "${{ env.branch_name }}"

steps.name: Do release
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail
git config user.name github-actions
git config user.email github-actions@github.com
cargo release \
  --execute \
  --no-push \
  --no-tag \
  --no-publish \
  --no-confirm \
  --verbose \
  --config release.toml \
  --allow-branch "${{ env.branch_name }}" \
  --dependent-version upgrade \
  "${{ inputs.version }}"

steps.name: Push new branch
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail
git push origin "${{ env.branch_name }}"

steps.name: Create PR
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail

nl=$'\n'
br=$'\n\n'
fence=$'```\n'
ecnef=$'\n```'

title="release: v${{ inputs.version }}"
body_intro="This is a release PR for version **${{ inputs.version }}**."
body_merge="**Use squash merge.**${nl}Upon merging, this will automatically build the CLI and create a GitHub release. You still need to manually publish the cargo crate."
body_pub="${fence}$ git switch main${nl}$ git pull${nl}$ git checkout v${{ inputs.version }}${nl}$ cargo publish${ecnef}"
body_notes="---${br}_Edit release notes into the section below:_${br}<!-- do not change or remove this heading -->${nl}### Release notes"

body="${body_intro}${br}${body_merge}${br}${body_pub}${br}${body_notes}${br}"

gh pr create --title "$title" --body "$body" --base main --head "${{ env.branch_name }}" --label "release"

steps.name: Extract info
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail

branch_name="release-${{ inputs.version }}"
echo "branch_name=${branch_name}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

steps.name: Make release branch
steps.run: git switch -c "${{ env.branch_name }}"

steps.name: Do release
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail
git config user.name github-actions
git config user.email github-actions@github.com
cargo release \
  --execute \
  --no-push \
  --no-tag \
  --no-publish \
  --no-confirm \
  --verbose \
  --config release.toml \
  --allow-branch "${{ env.branch_name }}" \
  --dependent-version upgrade \
  "${{ inputs.version }}"

steps.name: Push new branch
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail
git push origin "${{ env.branch_name }}"

steps.name: Create PR
steps.run:
set -euxo pipefail

nl=$'\n'
br=$'\n\n'
fence=$'```\n'
ecnef=$'\n```'

title='release: v${{ inputs.version }}'
body=$(sed 's/%version%/${{ inputs.version }}/g' .github/scripts/release-pr.txt)

gh pr create --title "$title" --body "$body" --base main --head "${{ env.branch_name }}" --label "release"
